disabled.description: Disable logging, no output after start.

detour.description: Tag of an outbound for connecting to the dns server.

client_subnet.description: Append a `edns0-subnet` OPT extra record with the specified IP prefix to every query by default.

reverse_mapping.description: Stores a reverse mapping of IP addresses after responding to a DNS query in order to provide domain names when routing.

strategy.description: Default domain strategy for resolving the domain names.

independent_cache.description: Make each DNS server's cache independent for special purposes. If enabled, will slightly degrade performance.

server_name.description: Used to verify the hostname on the returned certificates unless insecure is given.

alpn.description: List of supported application level protocols, in order of preference.

min_version.description: The minimum TLS version that is acceptable.

max_version.description: The maximum TLS version that is acceptable.

cipher_suites.description: A list of enabled TLS 1.01.2 cipher suites.

certificate.description: The server certificate line array, in PEM format.

certificate_path.description: The path to the server certificate, in PEM format.

key.description: The server private key line array, in PEM format.

key_path.description: The path to the server private key, in PEM format.

data_directory.description: The directory to store ACME data.

default_server_name.description: Server name to use when choosing a certificate if the ClientHello's ServerName field is empty.

email.description: The email address to use when creating or selecting an existing ACME server account.

provider.description: The ACME CA provider to use.

alternative_http_port.description: The alternate port to use for the ACME HTTP challenge.

alternative_tls_port.description: The alternate port to use for the ACME TLS-ALPN challenge.

external_account.description: EAB (External Account Binding) contains information necessary to bind or map an ACME account to some other account known by the CA.

key.description: ECH key line array, in PEM format.

key_path.description: The path to ECH key, in PEM format.

handshake.description: Handshake server address and Dial Fields.

private_key.description: Private key, generated by `sing-box generate reality-keypair`.

short_id.description: A hexadecimal string with zero to eight digits.

max_time_difference.description: The maximum time difference between the server and the client.

padding.description: If enabled, non-padded connections will be rejected.

enabled.description: Enable TCP Brutal congestion control algorithm.

idle_timeout.description: Specifies the time until idle clients should be closed with a GOAWAY frame.

ping_timeout.description: Specifies the timeout duration after sending a PING frame, within which a response must be received.

max_early_data.description: Allowed payload size is in the request.

early_data_header_name.description: Early data is sent in path instead of header by default.

idle_timeout.description: If the transport doesn't see any activity after a duration of this time, it pings the client to check if the connection is still active.

ping_timeout.description: The timeout that after performing a keepalive check, the client will wait for activity.

permit_without_stream.description: If enabled, the client transport sends keepalive pings even with no active connections.

fallback_for_alpn.description: Fallback server configuration for specified ALPN.

recv_window_conn.description: The QUIC stream-level flow control window for receiving data.

recv_window_client.description: The QUIC connection-level flow control window for receiving data.

max_conn_client.description: The maximum number of QUIC concurrent bidirectional streams that a peer is allowed to open.

handshake_for_server_name.description: Handshake server address for specific server name.

ignore_client_bandwidth.description: Commands clients to use the BBR CC instead of Hysteria CC.

masquerade.description: HTTP3 server behavior (Object configuration) when authentication fails.

rewrite_host.description: Rewrite the `Host` header to the target URL.

brutal_debug.description: Enable debug information logging for Hysteria Brutal CC.

type.description: QUIC traffic obfuscator type, only available with `salamander`.

auth_timeout.description: How long the server should wait for the client to send the authentication command

zero_rtt_handshake.description: Enable 0-RTT QUIC connection handshake on the client side

heartbeat.description: Interval for sending heartbeat packets for keeping the connection alive

interface_name.description: Virtual device name, automatically selected if empty.

address.description: IPv4 and IPv6 prefix for the tun interface.

auto_route.description: Set the default route to the Tun.

iproute2_table_index.description: Linux iproute2 table index generated by `auto_route`.

iproute2_rule_index.description: Linux iproute2 rule start index generated by `auto_route`.

auto_redirect.description: Improve TUN routing and performance using nftables.

strict_route.description: Enforce strict routing rules when `auto_route` is enabled.

route_address.description: Use custom routes instead of default when `auto_route` is enabled.

route_address_set.description: Add the destination IP CIDR rules in the specified rule-sets to the firewall.

route_exclude_address.description: Exclude custom routes when `auto_route` is enabled.

route_exclude_address_set.description: Add the destination IP CIDR rules in the specified rule-sets to the firewall.

include_uid_range.description: Limit users in route, but in range.

exclude_uid_range.description: Exclude users in route, but in range.

platform.description: Platform-specific settings, provided by client applications.

bypass_domain.description: Hostnames that bypass the HTTP proxy.

match_domain.description: Hostnames that use the HTTP proxy.

inet4_address.description: IPv4 prefix for the tun interface.

inet6_address.description: IPv6 prefix for the tun interface.

inet6_route_address.description: Use custom routes instead of default when `auto_route` is enabled.

inet4_route_exclude_address.description: Exclude custom routes when `auto_route` is enabled.

inet6_route_exclude_address.description: Exclude custom routes when `auto_route` is enabled.

network.description: Listen network, one of `tcp` `udp`. Both if empty.

authenticated_length.description: Protocol parameter. Enable length block encryption.

local_address.description: List of IP (v4 or v6) address prefixes to be assigned to the interface.

brutal_debug.description: Enable debug information logging for Hysteria Brutal CC.

zero_rtt_handshake.description: Enable 0-RTT QUIC connection handshake on the client side

heartbeat.description: Interval for sending heartbeat packets for keeping the connection alive

packet_encoding.description: UDP packet encoding, xudp is used by default.

user.description: SSH user, root will be used if empty.

host_key.description: Host key. Accept any if empty.

client_version.description: Client version. Random version will be used if empty.

extra_args.description: List of extra arguments passed to the Tor instance when started.

outbounds.description: List of outbound tags to select.

interrupt_exist_connections.description: Interrupt existing connections when the selected outbound has changed.

outbounds.description: List of outbound tags to test.

interrupt_exist_connections.description: Interrupt existing connections when the selected outbound has changed.

final.description: Default outbound tag. the first outbound will be used if empty.

auto_detect_interface.description: Bind outbound connections to the default NIC by default to prevent routing loops under tun.

override_android_vpn.description: Accept Android VPN as upstream NIC when `auto_detect_interface` enabled.

default_interface.description: Bind outbound connections to the specified NIC by default to prevent routing loops under tun.

default_fallback_delay.description: The length of time to wait before spawning a RFC 6555 Fast Fallback connection.

method.description: `default`: Reply with TCP RST for TCP connections, and ICMP port unreachable for UDP packets. `drop`: Drop packets.

no_drop.description: If not enabled, `method` will be temporarily overwritten to `drop` after 50 triggers in 30s.

sniffer.description: Enabled sniffers. All sniffers enabled by default.

action.description: Resolve request destination from domain to IP addresses.

server.description: Specifies DNS server tag to use instead of selecting through DNS routing.

external_ui.description: A relative path to the configuration directory or an absolute path to a directory in which you put some static web resource.
